intro: Lenidia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar lenidia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the rainy season. Lenidia madagascariensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
